com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.recovery

Class FailureUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.recovery.FailureUtils

  • public final class FailureUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides utility methods for the handling of failed Tasks.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean isPermanentlyFailed(Protos.TaskInfo taskInfo)
      Check if a Task has been marked as permanently failed.
      static void setPermanentlyFailed(StateStore stateStore, java.util.Collection<Protos.TaskInfo> failedTasks) 
      static void setPermanentlyFailed(StateStore stateStore, PodInstance podInstance)
      Marks all tasks associated with this pod as failed.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • isPermanentlyFailed

        public static boolean isPermanentlyFailed(Protos.TaskInfo taskInfo)
        Check if a Task has been marked as permanently failed.
        Parameters:
        taskInfo - The Task to check for failure.
        Returns:
        True if the Task has been marked, false otherwise.

      • setPermanentlyFailed

        public static void setPermanentlyFailed(StateStore stateStore,
                                        PodInstance podInstance)
        Marks all tasks associated with this pod as failed. This setting will effectively be automatically cleared when the pod is redeployed.
        Parameters:
        stateStore - the state storage where any updated tasks will be stored
        podInstance - the pod whose tasks will be marked as failed

      • setPermanentlyFailed

        public static void setPermanentlyFailed(StateStore stateStore,
                                        java.util.Collection<Protos.TaskInfo> failedTasks)
